intro: Cyathocephalum angustum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved cyathocephalum, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, commonly referred to as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing on rocky soils. Due to its unique appearance and adaptation to harsh climates, it is a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping.
